result.execSummary:
The defendant Fred Lee Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 4/27/15.  If not paid, a civil judgment will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber privileges for medical.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.  To be paid over the duration of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fred Lee Scott

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund check packet.
Bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety on 03/12/15.
Count two.
Count one.

Defendant Fred Lee Scott in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit of 4 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for medical.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 4.27.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 months in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence, and with Huber Privileges for medical.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by over the duration of probation or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs over the duration failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Fred Lee Scott in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 02-26-2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Fred Lee Scott in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 02-10-2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (Missed office contact.)

Defendant Fred Lee Scott in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 01-27-2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated December 17, 2014, received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
As of 12/1 this case is being reassigned to Judge McAdams and will be set on his calendar.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

Defendant Fred Lee Scott in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Patricia Daugherty for Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Oral Ruling. Court denies the Defense Motion. Defense requests case be set for Plea and Sentencing. Court orders case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 12-18-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated October 9, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Fred Lee Scott in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Randy P. Sitzberger for Nicole Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion Hearing proceeds. 
Sworn for the state:  Andrew Molina, Police Officer for the City of Milwaukee. Defense cross examine the witness. Defense offers Exhibit 1, DVD, received.  
Sworn for the state: John Scott, Police Officer for the City of Milwaukee.  State offers Exhibit 2, DVD, received. Closing Arguments heard. 
Court orders case adjourned for Oral Decision on 10-10-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Oral ruling scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated September 29, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Fred Lee Scott in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Marissa Santiago for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests case be set for Motion Hearing. Court orders case adjourned for Motion Hearing. 
Court addresses the Justice Point Pretrial Report.   Court reiterates: No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated August 5, 2014, received and filed.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Case calendared for SCHEDULING on 8/6/2014 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Fred Lee Scott in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The State needs a time time frame of the video. Court grants the State's request for an adjournment.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Case calendared for MOTION HEARING on 7/18/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15. Any motions are to be filed by 6/9/2014 and any response from the State is to be filed by 7/9/2014.

Defendant Fred Lee Scott in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The State is checking to see if there is a squad video. Case calendared for STATUS on 5/23/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Fred Lee Scott in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Nathaniel Adamson for Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #07CF3034 that are attached to the complaint.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Andrew Molina-MPD Officer.     State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Fred Lee Scott in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Fred Lee Scott in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
